item.title: Pizza
item.dc:creator: Tesla
item.content:encoded:
[container][row][column size="8"][header title="Pizza Recipe" description="If using wooden skewers, soak them in water to stop them burning. Place all of the kebab ingredients into a bowl, mix together, cover with clingfilm and refrigerate for at least 2 hours, or overnight if you have time." ][list][step title="Step 1" image="http://teslathemes.com/demo/wp/cuisinier/wp-content/uploads/2014/11/food-drinks-step1.jpg"]This is a fantastic, reliable, everyday pizza dough, which can also be used to make bread. It's best made with Italian Tipo '00' flour, which is finer ground than normal flour, and it will give your dough an incredible super-smooth texture. Look for it in Italian delis and good supermarkets. [/step][step title="Step 2" image="http://teslathemes.com/demo/wp/cuisinier/wp-content/uploads/2014/11/food-drinks-step2.jpg"]This is a fantastic, reliable, everyday pizza dough, which can also be used to make bread. It's best made with Italian Tipo '00' flour, which is finer ground than normal flour, and it will give your dough an incredible super-smooth texture. Look for it in Italian delis and good supermarkets. If using white bread flour instead, make sure it's a strong one that's high in gluten, as this will transform into a lovely, elastic dough, which is what you want. Mix in some semolina flour for a bit of colour and flavour if you like. [/step][step title="Step 3" image="http://teslathemes.com/demo/wp/cuisinier/wp-content/uploads/2014/11/food-drinks-step3.jpg"]This is a fantastic, reliable, everyday pizza dough, which can also be used to make bread. It's best made with Italian Tipo '00' flour, which is finer ground than normal flour, and it will give your dough an incredible super-smooth texture. Look for it in Italian delis and good supermarkets. If using white bread flour instead, make sure it's a strong one that's high in gluten, as this will transform into a lovely, elastic dough, which is what you want. Mix in some semolina flour for a bit of colour and flavour if you like. [/step][/list] [/column][column size="4"] [ingredients title="Ingredients"]
  • 1 kg white bread flour
  • 800g strong white bread flour
  • plus 200g finely
  • ground semolina flour
  • 1 teaspoon fine sea salt
  • 2 x 7 g dried yeast sachets
  • 1 tablespoon golden caster sugar
  • 4 tablespoons extra virgin olive oil
  • 650 ml lukewarm water
[/ingredients][cooktime title="Duration" image="http://teslathemes.com/demo/wp/cuisinier/wp-content/uploads/2014/11/clock-icon1.png" ]30 min[/cooktime][serves title="Serves" image="http://teslathemes.com/demo/wp/cuisinier/wp-content/uploads/2014/11/serve-icon.png"]4 seats[/serves][difficulty title="Difficulty" image="http://teslathemes.com/demo/wp/cuisinier/wp-content/uploads/2014/11/diagram-icon.png"]Medium[/difficulty] [/column][/row][/container]
item.excerpt:encoded: Every night can be pizza night with our comprehensive selection of both homemade pizzas and delicious toppings for pre-bought.

Look for it in Italian delis and good supermarkets. If using white bread flour instead, make sure it's a strong one that's high in gluten, as this will transform into a lovely, elastic dough, which is what you want. Mix in some semolina flour for a bit of colour and flavour if you like. [/step][step title="Step 3" image="http://teslathemes.com/demo/wp/cuisinier/wp-content/uploads/2014/11/food-drinks-step3.jpg"]This is a fantastic, reliable, everyday pizza dough, which can also be used to make bread. It's best made with Italian Tipo '00' flour, which is finer ground than normal flour, and it will give your dough an incredible super-smooth texture. Look for it in Italian delis and good supermarkets. If using white bread flour instead, make sure it's a strong one that's high in gluten, as this will transform into a lovely, elastic dough, which is what you want. Mix in some semolina flour for a bit of colour and flavour if you like. [/step][/list] [/column][column size="4"] [ingredients title="Ingredients"]
  • 1 kg white bread flour
  • 800g strong white bread flour
  • plus 200g finely
  • ground semolina flour
  • 1 teaspoon fine sea salt
  • 2 x 7 g dried yeast sachets
  • 1 tablespoon golden caster sugar
  • 4 tablespoons extra virgin olive oil
  • 650 ml lukewarm water
[/ingredients][cooktime title="Duration" image="http://teslathemes.com/demo/wp/cuisinier/wp-content/uploads/2014/11/clock-icon1.png" ]30 min[/cooktime][serves title="Serves" image="http://teslathemes.com/demo/wp/cuisinier/wp-content/uploads/2014/11/serve-icon.png"]4 seats[/serves][difficulty title="Difficulty" image="http://teslathemes.com/demo/wp/cuisinier/wp-content/uploads/2014/11/diagram-icon.png"]Medium[/difficulty] [/column][/row][/container]

item.title: Barbecue

[container][row][column size="8"][header title="Pizza Recipe" description="If using wooden skewers, soak them in water to stop them burning. Place all of the kebab ingredients into a bowl, mix together, cover with clingfilm and refrigerate for at least 2 hours, or overnight if you have time." ][list][step title="Step 1" image="http://teslathemes.com/demo/wp/cuisinier/wp-content/uploads/2014/11/food-drinks-step1.jpg"]This is a fantastic, reliable, everyday pizza dough, which can also be used to make bread. It's best made with Italian Tipo '00' flour, which is finer ground than normal flour, and it will give your dough an incredible super-smooth texture. Look for it in Italian delis and good supermarkets. It's best made with Italian Tipo '00' flour, which is finer ground than normal flour, and it will give your dough an incredible super-smooth texture. Look for it in Italian delis and good supermarkets. If using white bread flour instead, make sure it's a strong one that's high in gluten, as this will transform into a lovely, elastic dough, which is what you want. Mix in some semolina flour for a bit of colour and flavour if you like. [/step][step title="Step 3" image="http://teslathemes.com/demo/wp/cuisinier/wp-content/uploads/2014/11/food-drinks-step3.jpg"]This is a fantastic, reliable, everyday pizza dough, which can also be used to make bread. It's best made with Italian Tipo '00' flour, which is finer ground than normal flour, and it will give your dough an incredible super-smooth texture. Look for it in Italian delis and good supermarkets. If using white bread flour instead, make sure it's a strong one that's high in gluten, as this will transform into a lovely, elastic dough, which is what you want. Mix in some semolina flour for a bit of colour and flavour if you like. [/step][/list] [/column][column size="4"] [ingredients title="Ingredients"]
  • 1 kg white bread flour
  • 800g strong white bread flour
  • plus 200g finely
  • ground semolina flour
  • 1 teaspoon fine sea salt
  • 2 x 7 g dried yeast sachets
  • 1 tablespoon golden caster sugar
  • 4 tablespoons extra virgin olive oil
  • 650 ml lukewarm water
[/ingredients][cooktime title="Duration" image="http://teslathemes.com/demo/wp/cuisinier/wp-content/uploads/2014/11/clock-icon1.png" ]30 min[/cooktime][serves title="Serves" image="http://teslathemes.com/demo/wp/cuisinier/wp-content/uploads/2014/11/serve-icon.png"]4 seats[/serves][difficulty title="Difficulty" image="http://teslathemes.com/demo/wp/cuisinier/wp-content/uploads/2014/11/diagram-icon.png"]Medium[/difficulty] [/column][/row][/container]

item.title: Tiramisu
item.dc:creator: Tesla
item.content:encoded:
[container][row][column size="8"][header title="Pizza Recipe" description="If using wooden skewers, soak them in water to stop them burning. Place all of the kebab ingredients into a bowl, mix together, cover with clingfilm and refrigerate for at least 2 hours, or overnight if you have time." ][list][step title="Step 1" image="http://teslathemes.com/demo/wp/cuisinier/wp-content/uploads/2014/11/food-drinks-step1.jpg"]This is a fantastic, reliable, everyday pizza dough, which can also be used to make bread. It's best made with Italian Tipo '00' flour, which is finer ground than normal flour, and it will give your dough an incredible super-smooth texture. Look for it in Italian delis and good supermarkets. [/step][step title="Step 2" image="http://teslathemes.com/demo/wp/cuisinier/wp-content/uploads/2014/11/food-drinks-step2.jpg"]This is a fantastic, reliable, everyday pizza dough, which can also be used to make bread. It's best made with Italian Tipo '00' flour, which is finer ground than normal flour, and it will give your dough an incredible super-smooth texture. Look for it in Italian delis and good supermarkets. If using white bread flour instead, make sure it's a strong one that's high in gluten, as this will transform into a lovely, elastic dough, which is what you want. Mix in some semolina flour for a bit of colour and flavour if you like. [/step][step title="Step 3" image="http://teslathemes.com/demo/wp/cuisinier/wp-content/uploads/2014/11/food-drinks-step3.jpg"]This is a fantastic, reliable, everyday pizza dough, which can also be used to make bread. It's best made with Italian Tipo '00' flour, which is finer ground than normal flour, and it will give your dough an incredible super-smooth texture. Look for it in Italian delis and good supermarkets. If using white bread flour instead, make sure it's a strong one that's high in gluten, as this will transform into a lovely, elastic dough, which is what you want. Mix in some semolina flour for a bit of colour and flavour if you like. [/step][/list] [/column][column size="4"] [ingredients title="Ingredients"]
  • 1 kg white bread flour
  • 800g strong white bread flour
  • plus 200g finely
  • ground semolina flour
  • 1 teaspoon fine sea salt
  • 2 x 7 g dried yeast sachets
  • 1 tablespoon golden caster sugar
  • 4 tablespoons extra virgin olive oil
  • 650 ml lukewarm water
[/ingredients][cooktime title="Duration" image="http://teslathemes.com/demo/wp/cuisinier/wp-content/uploads/2014/11/clock-icon1.png" ]30 min[/cooktime][serves title="Serves" image="http://teslathemes.com/demo/wp/cuisinier/wp-content/uploads/2014/11/serve-icon.png"]4 seats[/serves][difficulty title="Difficulty" image="http://teslathemes.com/demo/wp/cuisinier/wp-content/uploads/2014/11/diagram-icon.png"]Medium[/difficulty] [/column][/row][/container]

Place all of the kebab ingredients into a bowl, mix together, cover with clingfilm and refrigerate for at least 2 hours, or overnight if you have time." ][list][step title="Step 1" image="http://teslathemes.com/demo/wp/cuisinier/wp-content/uploads/2014/11/food-drinks-step1.jpg"]This is a fantastic, reliable, everyday pizza dough, which can also be used to make bread. Look for it in Italian delis and good supermarkets. It's best made with Italian Tipo '00' flour, which is finer ground than normal flour, and it will give your dough an incredible super-smooth texture. Look for it in Italian delis and good supermarkets. If using white bread flour instead, make sure it's a strong one that's high in gluten, as this will transform into a lovely, elastic dough, which is what you want. Mix in some semolina flour for a bit of colour and flavour if you like. [/step][step title="Step 3" image="http://teslathemes.com/demo/wp/cuisinier/wp-content/uploads/2014/11/food-drinks-step3.jpg"]This is a fantastic, reliable, everyday pizza dough, which can also be used to make bread. It's best made with Italian Tipo '00' flour, which is finer ground than normal flour, and it will give your dough an incredible super-smooth texture. Look for it in Italian delis and good supermarkets. If using white bread flour instead, make sure it's a strong one that's high in gluten, as this will transform into a lovely, elastic dough, which is what you want. Mix in some semolina flour for a bit of colour and flavour if you like. [/step][/list] [/column][column size="4"] [ingredients title="Ingredients"]

  • 800g strong white bread flour
  • plus 200g finely
  • ground semolina flour
  • 1 teaspoon fine sea salt
  • 2 x 7 g dried yeast sachets

item.title: About Me
item.dc:creator: Tesla
item.content:encoded:
[section addclass="section-about-us margin-top-60 padding-double-bottom"][about title="Aurora Clarke" share="true"]As the worlds only manufacturer of planes and trains, weve built an extensive and diverse portfolio of winning mobility solutions. Everywhere people travel by land and in the air, a Bombardier product is ready to transport them. From category-defining business jets and commercial aircraft designed for the challenges of today, to sleek high speed trains and public transit thats smarter than ever.
Fast Company is the world's leading progressive business media brand, with a unique editorial focus on innovation in technology, ethonomics (ethical economics), leadership, and design. Written for, by, and about the most progressive business leaders, Fast Company and FastCompany.com inspire readers and users to think beyond traditional boundaries, lead conversations, and create the future of business.[/about][about_parallax author="Julia Child" ratio="0.6" image="http://teslathemes.com/demo/wp/cuisinier/wp-content/uploads/2014/11/about-parallax-background.jpg"] "In France, cooking is a serious art form and a national sport." [/about_parallax][skills title="Abilities and Skills"][skill title="Main Course" percentage="38"][skill title="Salads" percentage="50"][skill title="Desserts" percentage="73"][skill title="Drinks" percentage="59"][/skills][/section]

item.title: Thai Spaghetti
item.dc:creator: Tesla
item.content:encoded:
[container][row][column size="8"][header title="Pizza Recipe" description="If using wooden skewers, soak them in water to stop them burning. Place all of the kebab ingredients into a bowl, mix together, cover with clingfilm and refrigerate for at least 2 hours, or overnight if you have time." ][list][step title="Step 1" image="http://teslathemes.com/demo/wp/cuisinier/wp-content/uploads/2014/11/food-drinks-step1.jpg"]This is a fantastic, reliable, everyday pizza dough, which can also be used to make bread. It's best made with Italian Tipo '00' flour, which is finer ground than normal flour, and it will give your dough an incredible super-smooth texture. Look for it in Italian delis and good supermarkets. [/step][step title="Step 2" image="http://teslathemes.com/demo/wp/cuisinier/wp-content/uploads/2014/11/food-drinks-step2.jpg"]This is a fantastic, reliable, everyday pizza dough, which can also be used to make bread. It's best made with Italian Tipo '00' flour, which is finer ground than normal flour, and it will give your dough an incredible super-smooth texture. Look for it in Italian delis and good supermarkets. If using white bread flour instead, make sure it's a strong one that's high in gluten, as this will transform into a lovely, elastic dough, which is what you want. Mix in some semolina flour for a bit of colour and flavour if you like. [/step][step title="Step 3" image="http://teslathemes.com/demo/wp/cuisinier/wp-content/uploads/2014/11/food-drinks-step3.jpg"]This is a fantastic, reliable, everyday pizza dough, which can also be used to make bread. It's best made with Italian Tipo '00' flour, which is finer ground than normal flour, and it will give your dough an incredible super-smooth texture. Look for it in Italian delis and good supermarkets. If using white bread flour instead, make sure it's a strong one that's high in gluten, as this will transform into a lovely, elastic dough, which is what you want. Mix in some semolina flour for a bit of colour and flavour if you like. [/step][/list] [/column][column size="4"] [ingredients title="Ingredients"]
  • 1 kg white bread flour
  • 800g strong white bread flour
  • plus 200g finely
  • ground semolina flour
  • 1 teaspoon fine sea salt
  • 2 x 7 g dried yeast sachets
  • 1 tablespoon golden caster sugar
  • 4 tablespoons extra virgin olive oil
  • 650 ml lukewarm water
[/ingredients][cooktime title="Duration" image="http://teslathemes.com/demo/wp/cuisinier/wp-content/uploads/2014/11/clock-icon1.png" ]30 min[/cooktime][serves title="Serves" image="http://teslathemes.com/demo/wp/cuisinier/wp-content/uploads/2014/11/serve-icon.png"]4 seats[/serves][difficulty title="Difficulty" image="http://teslathemes.com/demo/wp/cuisinier/wp-content/uploads/2014/11/diagram-icon.png"]Medium[/difficulty] [/column][/row][/container]

item.content:encoded:

If using white bread flour instead, make sure it's a strong one that's high in gluten, as this will transform into a lovely, elastic dough, which is what you want. Mix in some semolina flour for a bit of colour and flavour if you like. [/step][/list] [/column][column size="4"] [ingredients title="Ingredients"]
  • 1 kg white bread flour
  • 800g strong white bread flour
  • plus 200g finely
  • ground semolina flour
  • 1 teaspoon fine sea salt
  • 2 x 7 g dried yeast sachets
  • 1 tablespoon golden caster sugar
  • 4 tablespoons extra virgin olive oil
  • 650 ml lukewarm water
[/ingredients][cooktime title="Duration" image="http://teslathemes.com/demo/wp/cuisinier/wp-content/uploads/2014/11/clock-icon1.png" ]30 min[/cooktime][serves title="Serves" image="http://teslathemes.com/demo/wp/cuisinier/wp-content/uploads/2014/11/serve-icon.png"]4 seats[/serves][difficulty title="Difficulty" image="http://teslathemes.com/demo/wp/cuisinier/wp-content/uploads/2014/11/diagram-icon.png"]Medium[/difficulty] [/column][/row][/container]
item.excerpt:encoded: Every night can be pizza night with our comprehensive selection of both homemade pizzas and delicious toppings for pre-bought.

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: A wonderful serenity has taken possession of my entire soul, like these sweet mornings of spring which I enjoy with my whole heart.

item.title: Hello world!
item.dc:creator: Tesla
item.content:encoded: Welcome to WordPress. This is your first post. Edit or delete it, then start blogging!

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: Hi, this is a comment. To delete a comment, just log in and view the post's comments. There you will have the option to edit or delete them.

item.title: Sample Page
item.dc:creator: Tesla
item.content:encoded:
This is an example page. It's different from a blog post because it will stay in one place and will show up in your site navigation (in most themes). Most people start with an About page that introduces them to potential site visitors. It might say something like this:
Hi there! I'm a bike messenger by day, aspiring actor by night, and this is my blog. I live in Los Angeles, have a great dog named Jack, and I like piña coladas. (And gettin' caught in the rain.)
...or something like this:
The XYZ Doohickey Company was founded in 1971, and has been providing quality doohickeys to the public ever since. Located in Gotham City, XYZ employs over 2,000 people and does all kinds of awesome things for the Gotham community.
As a new WordPress user, you should go to your dashboard to delete this page and create new pages for your content. Have fun!

item.title: Strawberry Fresh
item.dc:creator: Tesla
item.content:encoded:
If using wooden skewers, soak them in water to stop them burning. Place all of the kebab ingredients into a bowl, mix together, cover with clingfilm and refrigerate for at least 2 hours, or overnight if you have time. To make the tzatziki, crush the fennel seeds, garlic and sea salt in a pestle and mortar. Transfer to a bowl, add the remaining ingredients, mix and refrigerate, allowing the flavours to infuse. [recipe]
  • 50g rice
  • 2 small garlic cloves
  • 2 bird's eye chillies, seeds in, roughly chopped
  • 2 lime leaves, julienned
  • Juice of 2 limes
  • 1 tsp palm sugar
  • 2 tsp fish sauce
  • 2 tbsp coriander, chopped
[/recipe] Preheat a barbecue or griddle pan on a high heat. Skewer the pork, leaving little gaps between the pieces so the meat cooks more evenly. Cook the skewers over a high heat for about 8 to 10 minutes, turning occasionally until nicely charred and cooked all the way through, then set aside to rest. Grill the pitta breads for a minute on both sides. To make the dip, heat a dry frying pan and toast the uncooked rice until golden all over. Grind to a coarse powder in a pestle and mortar. Add the garlic and bash to a paste. Add the chillies and lime leaves then bash again. Finally add the lime juice, palm sugar and fish sauce, stir and taste. Stir in the coriander. Toss the squid in oil and skewer them. Throw them on the hottest part of the barbecue. Grill for about 2 minutes, depending on the size of the squid you have.
item.excerpt:encoded: Look for it in Italian delis and good supermarkets. Its best made with Italian Tipo 00 flour, which is finer ground.

item.title: Preparing Dough
item.dc:creator: Tesla
item.content:encoded:
If using wooden skewers, soak them in water to stop them burning. Place all of the kebab ingredients into a bowl, mix together, cover with clingfilm and refrigerate for at least 2 hours, or overnight if you have time. To make the tzatziki, crush the fennel seeds, garlic and sea salt in a pestle and mortar. Transfer to a bowl, add the remaining ingredients, mix and refrigerate, allowing the flavours to infuse. [recipe]
  • 50g rice
  • 2 small garlic cloves
  • 2 bird's eye chillies, seeds in, roughly chopped
  • 2 lime leaves, julienned
  • Juice of 2 limes
  • 1 tsp palm sugar
  • 2 tsp fish sauce
  • 2 tbsp coriander, chopped
[/recipe] Preheat a barbecue or griddle pan on a high heat. Skewer the pork, leaving little gaps between the pieces so the meat cooks more evenly. Cook the skewers over a high heat for about 8 to 10 minutes, turning occasionally until nicely charred and cooked all the way through, then set aside to rest. Grill the pitta breads for a minute on both sides. To make the dip, heat a dry frying pan and toast the uncooked rice until golden all over. Grind to a coarse powder in a pestle and mortar. Add the garlic and bash to a paste. Add the chillies and lime leaves then bash again. Finally add the lime juice, palm sugar and fish sauce, stir and taste. Stir in the coriander. Toss the squid in oil and skewer them. Throw them on the hottest part of the barbecue. Grill for about 2 minutes, depending on the size of the squid you have.
item.excerpt:encoded: It's best made with Italian Tipo '00' flour, which is finer ground than normal flour, and it will give your dough an incredible texture.
